ygData.subject: Re: Halo Of Light Uses Conjuration
ygData.msgSnippet: The explanation is that the spell DOES use Conjuration. Check EQStratics, right-click on the spell, or just try it yourself til the skill goes up... you ll
ygData.messageBody:
The explanation is that the spell DOES use Conjuration.
Check EQStratics, right-click on the spell, or just try it yourself til the
skill goes up... you'll see..

-----Original Message-----
From: Stefan Raets [mailto:SRAETS@...]
Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 7:54 AM
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eq_wizards] nd second question you speakRE:
[eq_wizards] Digest Number 76

From: "Stefan Raets" <SRAETS@...>


> No, eye of zom is conjuration that s right but halo of
> light is divination
> (as sense magic). A question for all of you guys :

It's funny though, I just checked it again and my Conjuration goes up
when casting the Halo of Light spell. Is it possible it checks
against both?
My Conjuration was at 0 before I got Halo, because I never used (never
got Eye of Zomm). Since I started using Halo it's gone up a few
points, very slowly, to 7 now. So my guess is it checks against both
Divination and Conjuration. That's the only explanation I can come up
with.

Aznyin
Level 16 Erudite Wizard
Chivalric Order of Norrath
Current Residence: Rivervale [Solusek Ro]
